body: I haven't gotten around to researching this, but I thought I might ask if there's anything you've learned since you posted?

Also, note that to use AA with Rails 4 you need to specify these gems:

``` ruby
gem 'activeadmin',         github: 'gregbell/active_admin', branch: 'rails4'
gem 'ransack',             github: 'ernie/ransack',         branch: 'rails-4'
gem 'inherited_resources', github: 'josevalim/inherited_resources'
gem 'formtastic',          github: 'justinfrench/formtastic'
```
@Daxter thanks for your time, I'm using the gems that you mention, but I didn't have luck registering two times the same model, I deactived this while I figure out how to make it work.

To confirm this is specifically a problem with the code on the `rails4` branch, could you use the latest code on `master` with the Rails 3 version of your app?

``` ruby
gem 'activeadmin', github: 'gregbell/active_admin'#, branch: 'rails4'
```

I have the same issue on the `rails4` branch of one of my apps.
However I have tried on the Rails 3 version of the app with the latest code on `master` and encountered the same issue so this doesn't seem to be a problem with the code on the `rails4` branch of ActiveAdmin.
Still no news about this issue Daxter ? Thx.

I have the same issue. And it seems that master branch is as buggy as rails4 branch. To confirm that i've created repository: https://github.com/dziulius/massive-avenger.
- rails-4 - branch with rails4 branch of AA from github
- stable - branch with AA from rubygems.rog
- rails-3-master - branch with master branch of AA from github

I did some git bisecting, and it seems that [this](https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/commit/5a7360474ded1496e004fd2f837eb7f1cc3725d3) is the commit to blame.

And the quick fix would be

``` ruby

ActiveAdmin.register Instructor, as: 'Instructor' do
  menu parent: 'Instructors', label: 'Approved Instructors'
  scope :active, default: true
  scope :contracted
  #...
```
@dziulius do you have an idea of what the problem is?
I should note that master has #2422 which recently changed the behavior of ResourceCollection.

I haven't investigated the code (I'm not really familiar with AA codebase), I've just used git bisect to track down the commit in AA, which is causing the issue. I hope tomorrow i'll have more time to dig deeper.

It appears the issue is order dependent, which explains why it occurs sporadically.

If a resource using the `:as` option is registered before the same resource without the `:as`, then it will not be added to the collection. The problem is how ResourceCollection searches for an existing resource.

Failing spec for the issue: https://gist.github.com/zorab47/6379735

The issue can be illustrated by registering two resources in the same file and changing the order of registration:

``` ruby
ActiveAdmin.register Instructor, as: "Applications"
ActiveAdmin.register Instructor
```

versus

``` ruby
ActiveAdmin.register Instructor
ActiveAdmin.register Instructor, as: "Applications"
```

issue.title: Renamed resource breaks its original resource.

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
My project uses AA 0.6.0 and it has resources that are registered multiple times with different `scoped_collection`. However, upgrading the gem to the master branch seems to break my use case of multiple resource registration.

To test this I freshly set up a rails project with `gem 'activeadmin', github: 'gregbell/active_admin'` and only one model.

When I register Post it works well.

```
ActiveAdmin.register Post do
end
```

But when I register DraftPost, Post disappears.

```
ActiveAdmin.register Post, as: 'DraftPost' do
end
```

When I open `http://aa.dev/admin/posts`, my local dev url, it returns `No route matches [GET] "/admin/posts"`.

Is this change planned or a breakage?

issue.title: CommentsController redirects to an aliased resource after creating a new comment.

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
When I write a comment on a resource that is registered multiple times, it succeeds saving a comment but failing to return to the resource page and produced an error in before_filter in `lib/active_admin/comments.rb`.

```
undefined method `admin_template_path' for #<Admin::CommentsController:0x007fea85333688>
```

I just upgraded to 0.6.0 and previously saving a comment on the same resource results redirecting to the other resource. For example, I have two resources registered like below:

```
ActiveAdmin.register Order do; ... end
ActiveAdmin.register Order, as: 'StockedOrders' do; ... end
```

When I write a comment on Order, it redirected to SrockedOrder#show however now it occurs an error.

issue.title: Fix for #2306

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
For #2306

If a resource using the `:as` option is registered before the same resource without the option would cause only one resource to be added to the ResourceCollection. This change fixes the issue by searching for existing resources by their `resource_name` object instead of a more forgiving search which could return an incorrect match (depending on file load order).

Any methods using `ResourceCollection.[]` to find resources by  resource name string, class name string, class, or base class should now use `ResourceCollection.find_matching_resource`.

issue.title: ResourceCollection#add to act on internal @resources directly

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
Using `ResourceCollection#[]` to check for existing resources could
potentially return an incorrect resource and it would wrongly determine
a resource was already in the collection. This change will ensure a resource
added is only considered present if its `resource.resource_name` object
is an exact match in the internal `@resources` hash.

Fixes #2306.

issue.title: Renamed resource causing issues when loaded out of order

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
Hello.  First I wanted to say thanks for making such a great gem.  AA is really awesome.

Yesterday I discovered some really odd behavior when dealing with renamed resources.

I have 2 models, users:

```
ActiveAdmin.register User do
...
end
```

and then invites.  I am using devise_invitable which adds columns to the users table for invites, so I did the following

```
ActiveAdmin.register User, :as => "Invite" do
...
end
```

All seems correct but I noticed if the "invites" get loaded before the "users" then active admin goes into a really bad state.  Users never shows up in the menu and routing gets trampled.  References to the users admin page return undefined methods:

```
undefined method `admin_user_path' for #<ActiveAdmin::Views::IndexAsTable:0x007f9d08673ca0>).   
```

Here is an example with screenshots:

Working:
![users___groundfloor_and_user_invites rb__developers](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4898672/1334171/4958b08a-35a4-11e3-81a6-a397c2403341.png)

Not Working:
![dashboard___groundfloor_and_1 _ruby](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4898672/1334179/67f9d14a-35a4-11e3-8a66-63f52afb229e.png)

Please let me know how I can help out.

Thanks in advance 
Chris

issue.title: Top profiles images pool

repository.name: trase
repository.description: Source code for Trase API and Frontend applications

issue.body:
PT task: https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/166790170

1. Add new tab to the menu: `Top Profile Images` where admin can upload images (without assigning them at this point)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6136899/60610610-19933100-9dbc-11e9-8982-ef154e19185e.png)
2. Create new top profile image and add it to a certain pool: assign it to specific `commodity` and `profile_type`; it means that when assigning images to top profiles we will filter the available images by top profile's context's commodity and its profile type (think: tags)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6136899/60610983-1cdaec80-9dbd-11e9-82cb-b2858cb7550f.png)
3. After successful record creation redirect to an index page of top profile images. Filter by `commodity` and `profile_type` on the right side.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6136899/60611385-1ac55d80-9dbe-11e9-80fd-18eecae6ef6f.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6136899/60611467-45afb180-9dbe-11e9-96c0-7a2430c45a27.png)
4. Assign top profile image to a top profile;
- first create a top profile
- after successful creation it redirects you to an edit page where you can assign an image from the available ones
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6136899/60612558-cc658e00-9dc0-11e9-8f54-08f74ed37387.png)
It's done on radio buttons, the UI could be improved with some jquery probably.
